Summary of environmental impacts, mitigation measures and monitoring programs
for oil transfer jetty for Krabi Thermal Power Plant Project.
00t:00:4000Environmentael Resources0          .0 -Environmetal Impa 0t                                   Mitig atiDn Me sre                              onitoring Programs
1. Air Quality                             - Construction Phasehas                                                                             - Construction  Phase
* Dust dispersion from  construction activities  * Water spraying twice a day on site access          TSP  measurements Ban  Khlong Rua
such  as  equipment transportation  and  site  roads and project area.                             twice a year.  Each measurement must
preparation.                                      *  reduce  truck  speed  during  passing  the   be performed for 3 consecutive daiys.
* The project site is surrounded  by rubber  villages.
plantations so the environmental impact can be
reduced naturally.
- GperaIionbase
* HC evaporation from tank farm 0.061 gm/sec
* HC evaporation from oil transfer/trip 0.98 kg.
* The amount of evaporated HC is very small so
it can be diluted by the atmosphere and will not
affect the air quality in the project area.



Environmental Resources                       Environmental Impact                             Mitigation Measure                        Monitoring Programs
2. Surface Water Quality                - CQnstru      o                               - ConstrulionPhase
The major waste water sources:
* Waste water from workers and construction   * Install septic system.
camp.

turbidity in the water                         reduce suspended sediment
* Tank Farm  and onshore  construction will  * Construct sedimentation  sump  to  collect

resources.
* Diffusion of suspended sediment by dredging
of navigation channel.
- QerationP                                    -
* Oily waste water from tank farm and jetty.   * Oily water from tank farm and jetty will be
collected by the collecting system into oil
separater to separate the oil prior to drain to
Khlong Si Bo Ya
* In case of oil spill                         * Tank Farm:
- oil will diffuse into the river and affect the  - Construct bund wall around the tank farm
sensitive areas in the nearby vicinity.       to contain oil spill in the tank farm area.

regularly drilled in cooperation with concerned
organizations.

4. Forestry & Wildlife                  - C:nstcuction Phase                          - Construction Phase

construction activities.                      mangrove area.

action for oil spill should be performed

project

40011/CHAPS/2540                                                   1111 f1u8WvDarunf Boor m7lXulai iinfl



11714n 3.2.2-1
T ABLEL
ROCK UNIT                                       ROCK DESCRIPTION
Zone "C'        Caystone (Shale ?)        gray to brownish gray and reddish brown mottling, stiff to hard,
silty and sandy, calcareous with shell fossil, interbedded with to
white to greenish grey sandstone and thin layers lignite
Interzone       Claystone (Shale?)       gray to greenish grey, stiff to hard, moderately to highly
calcareous with shell fossil.
Zone "B"        Claystone                 variegated reddish brown, brown to greenish gray, silty and
sandy, stiff to hard, with thin beds calcareous sandstone
and limestone.
Interzone       Claystone and sheal       gray to greenish grey, moderately hard, calcareous.
interbedded
Zone "A"        Claystone                 gray to dark brown, brownish grey, stiff to hard, silty
and sandy calcareous with shell fossil and potential lignite.
inn:     EGAT, 1982
4K004B/OEP'3/40                                   3-7
